get.description: This endpoint returns high-level information for all of the units in a sequence. Units are returned in the intended sequence order and are grouped by year.

parameters.name: sequence
parameters.description: The sequence slug identifier, including the key stage 4 option where relevant.

schema.description: The sequence slug identifier, including the key stage 4 option where relevant.
The year group to filter by. For the physical-education-primary sequence, a value of all-years can also be used.

get.description: This endpoint returns the video transcript and video captions file for a given lesson.

parameters.name: lesson
parameters.description: The slug of the lesson

schema.description: The slug of the lesson

get.summary: Lesson search using lesson video transcripts
get.description: Search for a term and find the 5 most similar lessons whose video transcripts contain similar text.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: A snippet of text to search for in the lesson video transcripts

schema.description: A snippet of text to search for in the lesson video transcripts

get.description:
This endpoint returns all assets for a given sequence, and the download endpoints for each. The assets are grouped by lesson.
This endpoint contains licence information for any third-party content contained in the lesson’s downloadable resources. Third-party content is exempt from the open-government license, and users will need to consider whether their use is covered by the stated licence, or if they need to procure their own agreement.

parameters.name: sequence
parameters.description: The sequence slug identifier, including the key stage 4 option where relevant.

schema.description: The sequence slug identifier, including the key stage 4 option where relevant.
The year group to filter by. For the physical-education-primary sequence, a value of all-years can also be used.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Use the this type and the lesson slug in conjunction to get a signed download URL to the asset type from the /api/lessons/{slug}/asset/{type} endpoint

schema.description:
Optional asset type specifier

Available values: slideDeck, exitQuiz, exitQuizAnswers, starterQuiz, starterQuizAnswers, supplementaryResource, video, worksheet, worksheetAnswers

get.description: This endpoint returns signed download URLs and types for available assets for a given key stage and subject, grouped by lesson. You can also optionally filter by type and unit.

parameters.name: keyStage
parameters.description: Key stage slug to filter by, e.g. 'ks2' - note that casing is important here, and should be lowercase

schema.description: Key stage slug to filter by, e.g. 'ks2' - note that casing is important here, and should be lowercase

parameters.name: subject
parameters.description: Subject slug to search by, e.g. 'science' - note that casing is important here (always lowercase)

schema.description: Subject slug to search by, e.g. 'science' - note that casing is important here (always lowercase)

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Use the this type and the lesson slug in conjunction to get a signed download URL to the asset type from the /api/lessons/{slug}/asset/{type} endpoint

schema.description: Optional unit slug to additionally filter by

get.description:
This endpoint returns the types of available assets for a given lesson, and the download endpoints for each. 
        This endpoint contains licence information for any third-party content contained in the lesson’s downloadable resources. Third-party content is exempt from the open-government license, and users will need to consider whether their use is covered by the stated licence, or if they need to procure their own agreement.

parameters.name: lesson
parameters.description: The lesson slug identifier

schema.description: The lesson slug identifier

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Use the this type and the lesson slug in conjunction to get a signed download URL to the asset type from the /api/lessons/{slug}/asset/{type} endpoint

get.description:
This endpoint will stream the downloadable asset for the given lesson and type. 
There is no response returned for this endpoint as it returns a content attachment.

parameters.name: lesson
parameters.description: The lesson slug

schema.description: The lesson slug

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Use the this type and the lesson slug in conjunction to get a signed download URL to the asset type from the /api/lessons/{slug}/asset/{type} endpoint

get.description: This endpoint returns an array of all available subjects and their associated sequences, key stages and years.
This endpoint returns the sequences, key stages and years that are currently available for a given subject.

parameters.name: subject
parameters.description: The slug identifier for the subject

schema.description: The slug identifier for the subject

get.summary: Sequencing information for a given subject
get.description: This endpoint returns an array of sequence objects that are currently available for a given subject. For secondary sequences, this includes information about key stage 4 variance such as exam board sequences and non-GCSE ‘core’ unit sequences.

parameters.name: subject
parameters.description: The slug identifier for the subject

schema.description: The slug identifier for the subject

get.description: This endpoint returns a list of key stages that are currently available for a given subject.

parameters.name: subject
parameters.description: The subject slug identifier

schema.description: The subject slug identifier

get.summary: Year groups for a given subject
get.description: This endpoint returns an array of years that are currently available for a given subject.

parameters.name: subject
parameters.description: Subject slug to filter by

schema.description: Subject slug to filter by

get.description: This endpoint returns all the key stages (titles and slugs) that are currently available on Oak
This endpoint returns an array of available published lessons for a given subject and key stage, grouped by unit.

parameters.name: keyStage
parameters.description: Key stage slug to filter by, e.g. 'ks2' - note that casing is important here, and should be lowercase

schema.description: Key stage slug to filter by, e.g. 'ks2' - note that casing is important here, and should be lowercase

parameters.name: subject
parameters.description: Subject slug to filter by, e.g. 'english' - note that casing is important here, and should be lowercase

schema.description: Subject slug to filter by, e.g. 'english' - note that casing is important here, and should be lowercase
Optional unit slug to additionally filter by

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: If limiting results returned, this allows you to return the next set of results, starting at the given offset point

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit the number of lessons, e.g. return a maximum of 100 lessons

get.description: This endpoint returns an array of units containing available published lessons for a given key stage and subject, grouped by year. Units without published lessons will not be returned by this endpoint.

parameters.name: keyStage
parameters.description: Key stage slug to filter by, e.g. 'ks2'

schema.description: Key stage slug to filter by, e.g. 'ks2'

parameters.name: subject
parameters.description: Subject slug to search by, e.g. 'science' - note that casing is important here (always lowercase)

schema.description: Subject slug to search by, e.g. 'science' - note that casing is important here (always lowercase)

get.description: The endpoint returns the quiz questions and answers for a given lesson. The answers data indicates which answers are correct, and which are distractors.

parameters.name: lesson
parameters.description: The lesson slug identifier

schema.description: The lesson slug identifier

get.description: This endpoint returns all quiz questions for a given sequence. The assets are separated into starter quiz and entry quiz arrays, grouped by lesson.

parameters.name: sequence
parameters.description: The sequence slug identifier, including the key stage 4 option where relevant.

schema.description: The sequence slug identifier, including the key stage 4 option where relevant.
The year group to filter by. For the physical-education-primary sequence, a value of all-years can also be used.

parameters.description: If limiting results returned, this allows you to return the next set of results, starting at the given offset point

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit the number of lessons, e.g. return a maximum of 100 lessons

Key stage slug to filter by, e.g. 'ks2' - note that casing is important here, and should be lowercase

get.description: This endpoint returns unit information for a given unit, including slug, title, number of lessons, prior knowledge requirements, national curriculum statements, prior unit details, future unit descriptions, and lesson titles that form the unit

parameters.name: unit
parameters.description: The unit slug

schema.description: The unit slug

get.description: This endpoint returns an array of all threads, across all subjects. Threads signpost groups of units that link to one another, building a common body of knowledge over time. They are an important component of how Oak’s curricula are sequenced.

get.summary: Units belonging to a given thread
get.description: This endpoint returns all of the units that belong to a given thread.
History of significant changes to the API with associated dates and versions

changes: All video assets now fully downloadable in mp4 format
Added /sequences/* and /subjects/* endpoints, and add support for unit optionality

get.description: Get the latest version and latest change note for the API

changes: All video assets now fully downloadable in mp4 format

get.description:
Check your current rate limit status (note that your rate limit is also included in the headers of every response).

This specific endpoint does not cost any requests.

example.transcript: Hello, I'm Mrs. Lashley. I'm looking forward to guiding you through your learning today...
example.vtt:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:06.300 --> 00:00:08.070
<v ->Hello, I'm Mrs. Lashley.</v>

2
00:00:08.070 --> 00:00:09.240
I'm looking forward to guiding you

3
00:00:09.240 --> 00:00:10.980
through your learning today...

starterQuiz.question: Match the number to its written representation.

supervisionlevel_id.description: The ID of the supervision level for the identified type of content. See ‘What are the types of content guidance?’ for more information.

contentGuidanceDescription.description: A detailed description of the type of content that we suggest needs guidance.

contentGuidance.description: Full guidance about the types of lesson content for the teacher to consider (where appropriate)

supervisionLevel.description: The ID of the supervision level for the identified type of content. See ‘What are the types of content guidance?’ for more information.

downloadsAvailable.description: Whether the lesson currently has any downloadable assets availableNote: this field reflects the current availability of downloadable assets, which reflects the availability of early-release content available for the hackathon. All lessons will eventually have downloadable assets available.

lessonKeywords.description: a word that joins words or ideas

keyLearningPoints.keyLearningPoint: And is a type of joining word.
A joining word can join two simple sentences.
Each simple sentence is about one idea and makes complete sense.
The second idea builds on to the first idea if ‘and’ is used to join them.
Grammatically accurate sentences start with capital letters and most often end with full stops.

misconceptionsAndCommonMistakes.misconception: Pupils may struggle to link related ideas together.
misconceptionsAndCommonMistakes.response: Give some non-examples to show what it sounds like when two ideas are unrelated e.g. Dad baked bread and she missed her sister.

example.pupilLessonOutcome: I can join two simple sentences with 'and'.

teacherTips.teacherTip: In Learning Cycle 1, make sure pupils are given plenty of opportunities to say sentences orally and hear that they make complete sense.

similarity.description: The snippet of the transcript that matched the search term

units.description: The units that the lesson is part of. See sample response below

example: A simple sentence is about one idea and makes complete sense.

limit.description: The maximum number of requests you can make in the current window.
